verses.verse: (Isa 1.2) “Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak; let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
(Isa 55.10, 11) May my teaching drop like the rain, my speech condense like the dew, like gentle rain on grass, like showers on new growth.
(Ex 33.19; Deut 3.24) For I will proclaim the name of the LORD, ascribe greatness to our God!
(vv 15, 18, 30|DEU 32:151830; Deut 7.9; Ps 92.15) The Rock, his work is perfect, and all his ways are just. A faithful God, without deceit, just and upright is he;
(Deut 31.29; Lk 9.41) yet his degenerate children have dealt falsely with him, (Meaning of Heb uncertain) a perverse and crooked generation.
(Deut 1.31) Do you thus repay the LORD, O foolish and senseless people? Is not he your father who created you, who made you and established you?
(Ex 13.14) Remember the days of old; consider the years long past; ask your father, and he will inform you, your elders, and they will tell you.

(Gen 11.8; Acts 17.26) When the Most High (Traditional rendering of Heb Elyon) apportioned the nations, when he divided humankind, he fixed the boundaries of the peoples according to the number of the gods; (Q ms Compare Gk Tg: MT the Israelites)
(1 Kings 8.51, 53; Jer 10.16) the LORD’s own portion was his people, Jacob his allotted share.
(Jer 2.6; Zech 2.8) He sustained (Sam Gk Compare Tg: MT found) him in a desert land, in a howling wilderness waste; he shielded him, cared for him, guarded him as the apple of his eye.
(Ex 19.4; Isa 31.5) As an eagle stirs up its nest and hovers over its young, as it spreads its wings, takes them up, and bears them aloft on its pinions,
(v 39) the LORD alone guided him; no foreign god was with him.
(Job 29.6; Isa 58.14) He set him atop the heights of the land and fed him with (Sam Gk Syr Tg: MT he ate) produce of the field; he nursed him with honey from the crags, with oil from flinty rock,
(Ps 147.14) curds from the herd, and milk from the flock, with fat of lambs and rams, Bashan bulls and goats, together with the choicest wheat— you drank fine wine from the blood of grapes.

(Deut 33.5, 26; Isa 1.4) Jacob ate his fill; (Q mss Sam Gk: MT lacks Jacob ate his fill) Jeshurun grew fat and kicked. You grew fat, bloated, and gorged! He abandoned God who made him and scoffed at the Rock of his salvation.
(Ps 78.58; 1 Cor 10.22) They made him jealous with strange gods; with abhorrent things they provoked him.
(Deut 28.64; Judg 5.8; Ps 106.37) They sacrificed to demons, not God, to deities they had never known, to new ones recently arrived, whom your ancestors had not feared.
(Ps 106.21; Isa 17.10) You were unmindful of the Rock that bore you; (Or that fathered you) you forgot the God who gave you birth.
(Ps 106.40; Jer 44.21-23) The LORD saw it and was jealous; (Q mss Gk: MT lacks was jealous) he spurned (Cn: Heb he spurned because of provocation) his sons and daughters.
(v 5|DEU 32:5; Deut 31.17, 29) He said, ‘I will hide my face from them; I will see what their end will be, for they are a perverse generation, children in whom there is no faithfulness.
(v 16|DEU 32:16; Rom 10.19) They made me jealous with what is no god, provoked me with their idols. So I will make them jealous with what is no people, provoke them with a foolish nation.
(Jer 15.14) For a fire is kindled by my anger and burns to the depths of Sheol; it devours the earth and its increase and sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.
(Deut 29.21; Ezek 5.16) I will heap disasters upon them, spend my arrows against them:
(v 33|DEU 32:33; Lev 26.22; Deut 28.22) wasting hunger, burning consumption, bitter pestilence. The teeth of beasts I will send against them, with venom of things crawling in the dust.
(2 Chr 36.17; Ezek 7.15) In the street the sword shall bereave, and in the chambers terror for young man and woman alike, nursing child and old gray head.
(Deut 4.27; Ps 34.16) I said, “I will make an end of them (Gk: Meaning of Heb uncertain) and blot out the memory of them from humankind,”
(Deut 9.26-28; Isa 10.13) but I feared provocation by the enemy, for their adversaries might misunderstand and say, “Our hand is triumphant; it was not the LORD who did all this.” ’
They are a nation void of sense; there is no understanding in them.
(Ps 81.13) If they were wise, they would understand this; they would discern what their end would be.
(v 4|DEU 32:4; Lev 26.7, 8) How could one have routed a thousand and two put a myriad to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, the LORD had given them up?
(1 Sam 2.2; 4.8) Indeed, their rock is not like our Rock; our enemies are fools. (Gk: Heb judges)
Their vine comes from the vinestock of Sodom, from the vineyards of Gomorrah; their grapes are grapes of poison; their clusters are bitter;
(Ps 58.4) their wine is the poison of serpents, the cruel venom of asps.
(Hos 13.12) Is not this laid up in store with me, sealed up in my treasuries,

(Rom 12.19; Heb 10.30) for the day of vengeance (Sam Gk: MT vengeance is mine) and recompense, for the time when their foot shall slip? Because the day of their calamity is at hand; their doom comes swiftly.
(Judg 2.18; Ps 106.45; 135.14; Joel 2.14) Indeed, the LORD will vindicate his people, have compassion on his servants, when he sees that their power is gone, neither bond nor free remaining.
(Jer 2.28) Then he will say, ‘Where are their gods, the rock in which they took refuge,
who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their libations? Let them rise up and help you; let them be your protection!
(Ps 50.22; Isa 41.4) See now that I, even I, am he; there is no god besides me. I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal; and no one can deliver from my hand.
For I lift up my hand to heaven and swear, As I live forever,
(Ezek 21.9, 10) when I whet my flashing sword and my hand takes hold on judgment, I will take vengeance on my adversaries and will repay those who hate me.
(Jer 46.10) I will make my arrows drunk with blood, and my sword shall devour flesh— with the blood of the slain and the captives, from the long-haired enemy.’

(Ps 85.1; Rom 15.10; Rev 19.2) Praise, O heavens, (Q ms Gk: MT nations) his people; worship him, all you gods! (Q ms Gk: MT lacks this line) For he will avenge the blood of his children (Q ms Gk: MT his servants) and take vengeance on his adversaries; he will repay those who hate him (Q ms Gk: MT lacks this line) and cleanse the land for his people.” (Q ms Sam Gk Vg: MT his land his people)
Moses came and recited all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he and Joshua (Sam Gk Syr Vg: MT Hoshea) son of Nun.
When Moses had finished reciting all these words to all Israel,

(Deut 6.6; Ezek 40.4) he said to them, “Take to heart all the words that I am giving in witness against you today; give them as a command to your children, so that they may diligently observe all the words of this law.
(Deut 30.20) This is no trifling matter for you but rather your very life; through it you may live long in the land that you are crossing over the Jordan to possess.”
Moses’s Death Foretold On that very day the LORD addressed Moses as follows:
(Num 27.12-14) “Ascend this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab across from Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites for a possession;
you shall die there on the mountain that you ascend and shall be gathered to your kin, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his kin,
(Num 20.11-13; 27.14) because both of you broke faith with me among the Israelites at the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin, by failing to maintain my holiness among the Israelites.
(Deut 1.37; 34.1-3) Although you may view the land from a distance, you shall not enter it, the land that I am giving to the Israelites.”
